intro: Thamnochortus striatus, commonly known as the striped ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and coastal environments, demonstrating remarkable drought tolerance. Its unique appearance and ability to thrive in harsh conditions make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
